## Motivation

Generative AI has a profound effect on our society and on businesses. The most prominent models generate natural language, which can be used in many applications, such as chat bots. Increasingly, the quality of image generative models and their adoption into multi-modal generative models, has increased dramatically. Nowaday, synthetic images can hardly be distinguished from real photographs (see @fig-genai-intro-receipt) and can be used in many domains. Ggenerating impressive images from scratch, however, is by far not the only task for generative models, as we will see.

::: {#fig-genai-intro-receipt}

![]({{< meta params.images_path >}}intro_receipt.jpg){height=300}

[Source](https://x.com/deedydas/status/1905909215308447874)
:::

CT scans expose the body to radiation and should thus avoided if possible. However, CT scans show bone structure much better than MRIs. This application helps get the best of both worlds.

## Definition

Let's contrast generative modellin with a classification task (see @fig-genai-intro-basics-classifier). In classification the model has as input an image and models a probability distribution over all classes.

::: {#fig-genai-intro-basics-classifier}

![]({{< meta params.images_path >}}basics_classifier.png)

Classification.
:::

In generative modelling the process is essentially reversed: The input (can) be a label, such as a class label, and the output is an image (see @fig-genai-intro-basics-elephant).

::: {#fig-genai-intro-basics-elephant}

![]({{< meta params.images_path >}}basics_elephant.png)

Generative modelling.
:::

One of the tricky aspects of generative modelling is that a specific input (e.g. the label "Elephant") should be associated with a distribution over possible elephants, i.e. it should not always generate the same image (see @fig-genai-intro-basics-elephant-prob). Since neural networks are inherently deterministic, we need a way to make the generator a **stochastic** function. This enables sampling to generate diverse outputs.


::: {#fig-genai-intro-basics-elephant-prob}

![]({{< meta params.images_path >}}basics_elephants_probabilistic.png)

Generative modelling with a diverse set of outputs.
:::
